channel.title: Run.bat isn't working :(
channel.description:
on my server i have succefully compiled to the point where it says starting testscape then i leave compile only to find that my run.bat isn't working
this is some vital information i will leave you with so that you guys can help me
note: iam running on the latest java and i have both [jdk] and [jre] installed
in my compile folder :
@echo off title m0d Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe" server pause
in my run.bat folder :
@echo off title BcScape Server java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server @pause
in my environmental variables
CLASSPATH = C:/program files\java\jdk1.5.0.09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.
PATH = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0.09\bin\java.exe
please help!

item.title: Run.bat isn't working :(
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Notice how your compiler is compiling AND starting the server? What you have in your runserver is useless rubbish. Delete the RunServer, and replace its contents with the second to last line of the compiler. Also, fix the ’ / ', it should be a backslash. ( \ ).

Read full topic

your all viewing but not helping

item.description:
@l0l_l0rd wrote:

on my server i have succefully compiled to the point where it says starting testscape
then i leave compile only to find that my run.bat isn’t working

this is some vital information i will leave you with so that you guys can help me

note: iam running on the latest java and i have both [jdk] and [jre] installed

in my compile folder :

@echo off
title m0d Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe” server
pause

in my run.bat folder :

title BcScape Server
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
@pause

CLASSPATH = C:/program files\java\jdk1.5.0.09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

please help!
